DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare long-term effect anodal versus cathodal transcranial direct current stimulation ( tDCS ) motor recovery subacute stroke patient . Forty patient subacute ischemic stroke randomly assign one three group : Anodal , Cathodal Sham . Each group receive tDCS intensity 2mA 25 minute daily 6 consecutive day affect ( Anodal , Sham ) unaffected ( Cathodal ) motor cortex . Patients assess National Institutes Health Stroke Scale ( NIHSS ) , Barthel index ( BI ) Medical Research Council ( MRC ) muscle strength scale baseline , end 6th tDCS session , 1 , 2 3 month later . Motor cortical excitability measure baseline 6th session hemisphere .
